text:
541-549, and 551-553 Hudson Street, west side, at and north
across Perry Street.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Hudson Street and Perry Street, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)
Thanksgiving Ragamuffins, 1933, No. 37. The return of the native. Hudson Street at Perry, with tho northwestern corner
in the background.
November 30, 1933.
L. Sperr.
(2)
No. 38. Another group on the same corner.
November 30, 1933.
. 4
P. L. Sperr.
:
i.
(3)
No. 39. The three masked redskins and some of the group we saw in No. 15 and other pictures at Bleecker and Perry Streets.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Thanksgiving ragamuffins, No.37-39.

folder: Hudson Street and Perry Street, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)
Thanksgiving Ragamuffins, 1933, No. 46. Looking north on the west side of Hudson Street from and including Perry Street.

November 30, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
No. 47. Another group of individuals we have seen earlier in this series.

November 30, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
No. 48. A dusky sextet --- Alexander's Tin Can Band, on Hudson Street. The background is the east side of Hudson Street from Perry to West 11th Streets. Notice the Tavern. Repeal is about to go into effect, but this saloon will positively not be allowed to return.

November 30, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Thanksgiving ragamuffins, No.46-48.

folder: Hudson Street & Perry Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
549 and 547 Hudson Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Perry Street (right).  Also shown is the south side of Perry Street, West from Hudson and across Greenwich (Ninth Ave. Elevated Line thereon) Streets.

August 3, 1937

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Perry Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Perry Street, west from No. 99 (right) a point east of Hudson, across same to West Streets and showing the Ninth Ave. Elevated Line
on Greenwich Street.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A similar view slightly westward.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Another view photographed from a point midway between Greenwich and Washington Streets. The elevated structure shown is that of New York Central Railroad which runs on Washington Street. The 5-story tenements appearing on the left are Nos. 135 and 137.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Perry Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Perry Street, east from Hudson Street and showing respectively at the N.W. and N.E. corners of Bleecker Street, two white buildings; Nos. 91 (also 386 Bleecker Street) and 87 (also 385 Bleecker Street).
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
